Articles.Content:
So, I've been looking at getting some 3d prints, mainly a planet or two and a favorite craft or two. But the Eucl3d site is confusing, as it doesn't list a price anywhere...is this because of the varying size of craft? If so, what's an average price I could expect?

Also, does it work with part clipping, or is that a definite no-go? Like if a wing is made up of many wing components clipped in a way that makes a certain wing shape, will that work with the 3d printing, or no?

Thanks. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> planets you want from here: [http://www.shapeways.com/shops/kerbalspaceprogram](http://www.shapeways.com/shops/kerbalspaceprogram)

Oh I know, I only mentioned them cause I found them first. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
AFAIK The prices of the craft are (US) 99$ for a small, 149$ for a medium, and 199$ for a large. I don't what the exact scale is at, but somewhere around a foot and a half for the large size.

> 
> AFAIK The prices of the craft are (US) 99$ for a small, 149$ for a medium, and 199$ for a large. I don't what the exact scale is at, but somewhere around a foot and a half for the large size.

Holy $$$$! that's a lot of money!

I really wanted one too ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) I won't be able to afford even a small though. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Yeah, it is a ton of money. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

There's always papercraft KSP.

And for me there are renderings. Gotta check if that .mu importer is updated yet...

> 
> Yeah, it is a ton of money. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
> There's always papercraft KSP.
> 
> And for me there are renderings. Gotta check if that .mu importer is updated yet...

But papercraft and renderings are nothing compared to your favorite craft sitting on your desk. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> But papercraft and renderings are nothing compared to your favorite craft sitting on your desk. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

True, that.
Kind of(definitely) late, but now the price for a small is $24.99 USD!
